meanings.definition: Making a harsh, high-pitched sound when being moved or pressure is applied.
meanings.sent1: The old door was the creakiest in the house.
meanings.sent2: The wooden floor was the creakiest part of the room.
meanings.sent3: The creakiest chair in the classroom always made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: The creakiest stairs in the old house echoed with each step.
meanings.sent5: The creakiest gate in the garden sounded like a haunted moan.

meanings.definition: Having the most creaks or squeaks.
meanings.sent1: Among all the bikes, his was the creakiest.
meanings.sent2: The creakiest wheel on the cart needed oiling.
meanings.sent3: The creakiest toy in the box always made the loudest noise.
meanings.sent4: The creakiest floorboard in the attic groaned underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The creakiest hinge on the door protested loudly when opened.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of age or wear through creaking noises.
meanings.sent1: The creakiest book on the shelf had yellowed pages.
meanings.sent2: The creakiest window in the house let in a draft.
meanings.sent3: The creakiest floor in the gym made exercising more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The creakiest tree in the forest swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The creakiest boat on the lake had weathered sails.
